programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
In Burton upon Trent, Lee is in a race against time to rescue a coach that's careered off a road and straight into a hedgerow. Coaches are notoriously difficult to rescue, and with rush hour fast approaching on this busy commuter rat-run, the pressure is on

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
An arrest snowballs into a firearms stand-off for Damo, while Spike uncovers a stash of cannabis stored with shotguns and police dog Ronnie lands right on top of a wanted man. Ben chases a runaway driver, and Paul catches a hit-and-run culprit, who then kicks off in his car
S13E07

programme.title: Never So Few (1959)
programme.desc: US captain Tom C Reynolds is serving in Burma and training soldiers in modern warfare to help fight the Japanese. However, when his unit is attacked by supposed allies, Reynolds risks the wrath of his superiors and sets out on a mission of revenge. Second World War drama, starring Frank Sinatra, Gina Lollobrigida, Steve McQueen and Charles Bronson

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
A 999 call leads to a drugs bust for Liam, and Jacko and the firearms unit rush to flush out a suspect after finding a homemade gun. Dog handler Justin sniffs out the truth when a mum and son tell lies over who a crashed a car, and there is a dangerous high-speed pursuit through the streets of Darlington

programme.title: Motorway Cops: Catching Britain's Speeders
programme.desc:
PC Andy Doran makes his way to the scene of a collision on the A6, where a tired young driver has fallen asleep at the wheel and crashed his car into a lamp post. On the edge of the Peak District, PC Amy Hollis is on the scene of a crash where a car has come off the road and hit a bridge 60ft above a river
S02E09

programme.desc:

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc:
Documentary showing how CCTV and other technological advances are helping to bring car thieves to justice. Suspected criminals in Chester are involved in a high-speed chase through the city centre, and there is footage that helped put an end to one of London's most prolific gangs. The programme also includes film of a getaway in which robbers tried to evade the law by driving at 180mph

programme.title: Trucking Hell

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

Tasers are drawn after a van driver causes carnage and a wanted man holes up in a loft and refuses to come quietly, resulting in a shower of loft insulation, pepper spray and abuse

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:

S14E02

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc:
With North Yorkshire's roads a big draw for bikers, policing them is a top priority. A 70-year-old biker crashes down an embankment but is spared serious injury thanks to a gadget
S12E17

programme.title: Police: Suspect No 1
programme.desc:
Documentary following the work of police officers and detectives as they attempt to identify those responsible for criminal acts, exploring the intricacies of producing irrefutable evidence, conducting interviews and finding ways to make the guilty confess. The first edition focuses on an armed robbery in Norfolk in which a vehicle is stolen and innocent people are shot

programme.title: Trucking Hell
programme.desc:
At the start of the pandemic, but before the lockdown, a lorry containing vital medical supplies is involved in a collision with another truck on a busy A-road in Leicestershire. Merle heads to Gravesend to winch out a delivery truck that has got stuck in an alleyway, and Marta picks up a bin lorry whose rear steering is broken - but getting such a large vehicle onto a low-loader is no mean feat
S03E17

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Hide and Seek: Jacko has to deal with a suspected drug dealer who seems to have found a novel way of hiding his stash, and Mark and Steve stop a suspicious man trying to hide his true identity. Meanwhile, after a high-speed pursuit, interceptor Liam hunts down a wanted teenager
S13E03

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
Young and Reckless: Cameras follow elite teams from the Durham and Cleveland forces as they tackle young, reckless drivers who cause carnage on the roads and put themselves and others in danger. Spike and dog handler Ian pursue a 20-year-old drunk driver who tries to lose them on a travellers' site, Ben goes head to head with a speeding boy racer, and Spike switches four wheels for two as he gets on his bike to catch illegal off-roaders tearing it up on the beach
S13E06

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc:
The pursuit of a white van tearing up the turf in Willington proves to be a family affair, while two-year-old German shepherd cross Titan earns his spurs, and Paul is sent on a roundabout hunt for a drunk driver. And Sam discusses police policy with a disqualified driver who will not accept he's in the wrong
S13E08

programme.title: Rio Grande (1950)
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. John Ford's Western, with John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish

Thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Denzel Washington and Viggo Mortensen

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc:
Alexander Van Tulleken considers the deadly effects of diet pills and whether breakfast truly is the most important meal. Plus, the myth that local honey helps hayfever is busted
S01E09

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: Episode 8 (Shortened): Paramedics attending to a man found slumped in Edinburgh city centre suspect an overdose of 'street Valium'. They also treat a frail pensioner with a suspected broken hip

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc:
A one-bedroom flat in Hackney, central London, a semi in Stoke-on-Trent and a cottage with huge potential in a village just outside Bath are sold at online property auctions. Once renovated, the developers who bought them all hope to turn a profit on their investments. Presented by Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Jacqui Joseph
S26E18

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:
Sandown Park 15: Experts Raj Bisram and Catherine Southon help teams at Sandown Park Racecourse in Surrey find items of value. Before heading off to the auction, presenter Eric Knowles pays a visit to the Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, where they use the exhibits to offer reminiscence therapy to people with memory problems
S54E09

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc:
An Audience with Al Haskey: Imogen talks to Sid about Rob, Ollie and Scarlett continue to flirt, and Bear shows Tanisha the mill. Al is shocked to meet a patient who is live-streaming his life
S24E54

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
The team has just one day to help Jan, who works seven days a week, transform her bedroom into a relaxing sanctuary and give her space to rediscover her love of fashion
S01E12

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Somerset Borders: Sonali Shah helps a couple find a new home in Somerset where they can create their very own back garden vegetable patch. Away from the search, Sonia also learns about the potentially perilous Bristol Channel and meets the volunteers who operate two life-saving rescue hovercrafts
S21E35

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:
Nigel Havers and expert auctioneer Simon Bower welcome five more people to the Bidding Room with another batch of weird and wonderful lots. The dealers bid against each other on a fairground dodgem, two figurines, a pair of ornate candlesticks, a vintage garden sprayer and a rescued mannequin
S02E10

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc:
Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford
S03E19

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc:
Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Rose Matafeo
S29E19

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Liberal Democrats

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: 27/04/2023: Alex Jones, Roman Kemp and a team of roving reporters present topical stories from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Jack and Denise are concerned when Amy goes missing. Keanu feels under increasing financial pressure and decides to take Ravi up on his offer for the delivery job, but things do not go to plan. Later, Callum worries that Ben is avoiding talking about his feelings

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
This week's seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to test their culinary wits. Challenges include cooking a dish to a brief set by one of the country's toughest food critics, Leyla Kazim. John Torode and Gregg Wallace will be passing judgement as usual
S19E08

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at HWKR Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?
S02E05

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Look East
programme.desc: News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Greenford, west London, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc:
Impressionist Alistair McGowan, football influencer Chris Dixon, comedian Laura Lexx and BBC Sport journalist Holly Hamilton are in the famous black chair, answering Clive Myrie's questions on Claude Debussy, British birds of prey, the history of alternative comedy, and Roald Dahl's Matilda
S20E13

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc:

S52E21

programme.desc: Episode 9 (Shortened): Paramedics treat a woman who has collapsed in the heat, and 999 call handlers deal with a patient having a heart attack while on the phone

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc:

Christina discovers the history of the humble jigsaw and takes a closer look at a huge collection of puzzles
S64E30

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc:
Marlene is unable to investigate a racing pigeon theft, as she is allergic to birds. Al and Callum discover that the owner may be better off without his feathered friends due to a rare medical condition that could kill him. Finn tells Siobhan that he's decided to move out of the family home, so she turns her attentions to Port Devine's most eligible bachelor. Niamh catches her father drinking while working
S02E07

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc:
Retired couple Steven and Sue love their two-bedroom bungalow, but Steven's mobility issues have left Sue taking on more of the workload, and their tired, cluttered shed does not help matters. The team sets out to turn the shed into a practical and welcoming space for Sue to do her volunteer work, and make it easier for Steven to access his mobility scooter
S01E05

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc:
Cotswolds: In the Cotswolds, Nicki Chapman and a couple from Scotland don't need to look too far to find the characterful cottage of their dreams for a £600,000 budget. While in the locality, Nicki drops in on showjumping legend and double Olympic gold medallist Nick Skelton, along with his sons Harry and Dan, who are following in their father's 'hoof' prints
S21E42

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc:

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc:
Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.desc:

In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

programme.desc:

Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.desc:
The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition
S02E06

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The Repair Shop: A Royal Visit: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:

Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The Repair Shop: A Royal Visit: In an episode recorded in autumn 2021 to mark the BBC's centenary, Jay Blades meets King Charles III, who was then the Prince of Wales, to explore their shared passion of preserving heritage craft skills. Jay, ceramics expert Kirsten Ramsay, horologist Steve Fletcher, and furniture restorer Will Kirk are invited to Dumfries House in Scotland to meet Charles and learn about The Prince's Foundation's work to train the next generation of craftspeople

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc:
The teams venture through Canada's friendliest provinces - New Brunswick, Prince Edward Island and Nova Scotia, as they head to the seventh checkpoint in Liverpool, Nova Scotia. Zainib and Mobeen plan to test the friendly reputation of the area and rely on local hospitality to get them to their destination. Claudia and Kevin are running on fumes and are in desperate need of some good luck as they end up spending money to go backwards. Tricia and Cathie start to feel the stress of the race getting to them and put their efforts into rallying together for the final push and Monique and Ladi feel the pressure as the only team remaining to have not won a leg yet
S03E07

programme.desc: On the eve of their high-school graduation, two academic superstars and best friends realise they should have worked less and played more. Determined not to fall short of their peers, the girls try to cram four years of fun into one night. Comedy directed by Olivia Wilde and starring Kaitlyn Dever, Beanie Feldstein and Jessica Williams

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
In the Lake District, Gordon tasks the contenders to collect pine needles and cones from 40-foot trees to infuse into Michelin-starred Mille Feuille in a bid to demonstrate how they can turn humble ingredients into profit. Next, they create bottled sauces to sell at Hawkr Market in Gateshead, Tyne and Wear. It's a crowded market, so will anyone impress the secret industry greats Gordon has invited to the venue - and will anyone convince Sauce Shop enough to launch their brand as a 'special edition'?

programme.desc:

S16E01

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc:
The fourth quarter-final sees the week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They must cook two courses that will excite not just regular judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace, but also 2020 champion Thomas Frake, 2010 champion Dhruv Baker and 2021 finalist Alexina Anatole. All three of their forerunners have gone on to forge careers in the food industry
S19E12

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc:
Gordon celebrates the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to the Fish Society in Surrey where he tasks them with perfectly de-shelling one of the most expensive foods to be found on any menu - lobster. He then puts the contenders in charge of his high-end Mayfair restaurant, Lucky Cat. With his reputation on the line and paying diners expecting immaculate food and service, he expects them to live up to his own extraordinarily high standards in order to have any hope of proceeding in the competition
S02E06

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg leads a team of BBC reporters as the votes in 8,000 seats are counted at 230 councils across England. Mayoral elections are also taking place in Bedford, Leicester, Mansfield and Middlesbrough. Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens and Professor John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC's Political Editor Chris Mason analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results

From piano pioneers like Little Richard, Nina Simone and Ray Charles, who showed the world that the new sounds of pop and rock didn't just revolve around guitars, right through to modern maestros like Elton John, Lady Gaga and Jools Holland

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: In February 2022, a video emerged of a young Afghan woman screaming for help whilst her door was being kicked in by the Taliban. Little is known about what took place after - where was she taken and for what reason? Yalda Hakim travels to Afghanistan after gaining access to her and her family after they were released from prison and as they plot their escape from Afghanistan to Europe.

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: In this week's Talking Business, Aaron Heslehurst travels to Rabat to explore Morocco's push into big renewable energy projects. Morocco wants to be a net exporter of clean energy to its neighbours and Europe but it still sources 40% of its own electricity from imported coal. How realistic is Morocco's move towards net zero and how quickly can it achieve it.

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: Extreme Conservation
programme.desc:
The Maldives: In Extreme Conservation, presenter Michaela Strachan travels the world meeting people battling the effects of climate change, who are intervening in extreme ways to save species or entire ecosystems. In this edition, Michaela is in the Maldives, which is facing an existential challenge from global warming - its picture-postcard sand islands are literally being washed from the map. Research teams from around the world have been invited in to work with local scientists to try to quickly develop solutions before it's too late, and she meets those behind some of the more ambitious projects. Coral reefs are key to protecting the islands from storms and surges, but as the oceans warm, they are being killed off by coral bleaching. Scientists in the Maldives are trying different techniques to resurrect the reefs, from the use of electricity to promote growth to the search for more resilient species. As tourism and the population of the Maldives continue to grow, more land is needed for develop
S01E02

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg is your guide as the votes are counted in 2023’s bumper set of elections. BBC correspondents are at the key counts all around the country. In the studio, Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens, and Professor Sir John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC’s political editor, Chris Mason, analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results.

programme.title: Elections 2023
programme.desc: Laura Kuenssberg is your guide as the votes are counted in 2023’s bumper set of elections. BBC correspondents are at the key counts all around the country. In the studio, Reeta Chakrabarti crunches the numbers on her giant screens, and Professor Sir John Curtice assesses the underlying electoral trends. The BBC’s political editor, Chris Mason, analyses what these elections mean for each political party, and senior politicians are on hand to give their verdict on the results.

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways
S15E01

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 13 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the opening session of the second semi-final. There was nothing between John Higgins and Ronnie O'Sullivan at the end of last year's corresponding session, as they went into Friday's play level at 4-4, but it was O'Sullivan who would eventually prevail and go on to win the title for the seventh time in his illustrious career

programme.title: Stan & Ollie (2018)
programme.desc: Biopic of Laurel and Hardy, focusing on the events of 1953 as the comedy duo try to re-ignite their film careers by embarking on a gruelling tour of British variety halls. As they set out on their demanding schedule, with their wives back home in the US, Stan is distracted by his attempts to pin down the producer of their proposed comeback film and Ollie tries to heal a rift caused by a perceived professional betrayal. The build-up of pressure starts to tarnish their precious partnership. Steve Coogan and John C Reilly star

programme.title: The Belles of St Trinian's (1954)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls hope to get rich quick by betting on a racehorse belonging to a classmate's wealthy father. However, they first have to foil a gang of thieves planning to steal the animal and outwit an undercover policewoman sent to infiltrate the school disguised as a teacher. Comedy, starring Alastair Sim, Joyce Grenfell and George Cole

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: The rural idyll of eight-year-old David Copperfield is brought to an abrupt end when his widowed mother Clara remarries. Young David takes an instant dislike to Mr Murdstone, his new stepfather, and the newcomer proves the feeling is more than mutual when he send the lad away to a boarding school run by a ruthless headmaster. Adaptation of the Dickens classic with an all-star cast, including Pauline Quirke, Maggie Smith and Ian McKellen, with a young Daniel Radcliffe starring in the title role

programme.title: Christo and Jeanne-Claude: Monumental Art
programme.desc: Documentary which charts the creation of world-renowned artist Christo's first public work of art in the UK, the Mastaba. In the summer of 2018, on the Serpentine in London's Hyde Park, Christo constructed the Mastaba from 7,506 painted oil barrels. The work was inspired by ancient Mesopotamian tombs and weighs six hundred tonnes. It is the latest work in a career spanning half a century and stretching across the world, and the programme looks back on Christo's career and a life spent making provocative works of art with his wife and partner Jeanne-Claude

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc:
The Trains That Time Forgot: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys: Andrew Martin investigates why named trains, once the pride of the railway companies that ran them, have now largely been confined to locomotive history. Embarking on a series of rail journeys around Britain, Andrew revisits the routes travelled by the Flying Scotsman, the Cornish Riviera Express and the Brighton Belle, three of Britain's most famous named trains, as he reflects on the bygone golden age of railways
S15E01

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from August 8, 1994, featuring music by Maxx, Level 42, Ce Ce Peniston, Status Quo, Rozalla, Whitesnake, PJ and Duncan, Youssou N'dour with Neneh Cherry and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Simon Mayo presents music by Brand New Heavies, Future Sound of London, Shampoo, DJ Miko, Joe Cocker, Carleen Anderson, Let Loose and Wet Wet Wet in an edition originally broadcast on August 10, 1994

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1985: Mike Read and Gary Davies present the chart programme, first broadcast on April 25 1985, featuring Bronski Beat and Marc Almond, Phil Collins, New Model Army, DeBarge, Eurythmics, Freddie Mercury, David Grant and Jaki Graham and USA for Africa

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1988: Gary Davies and Nicky Campbell introduce the edition from April 24, featuring Pat and Mick, James Brown, Fairground Attraction, Brenda Russell, the Primitives, Luther Vandross, Joyce Sims, Bananarama, Will Downing, S'Express and Scott Fitzgerald

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Further coverage of day 14 from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the third session of the opening semi-final. Mark Williams enjoyed his strongest session of his match against Judd Trump at this stage last year, winning six of eight frames to reduce his opponent's lead to 13-11 and receiving a standing ovation. However, it was ultimately 'the Juddernaut' who progressed to the final

programme.title: Totally 60s Psychedelic Rock at the BBC
programme.desc: A compilation of the genre from programmes such as Colour Me Pop, How It Is, Top of the Pops and Once More with Felix. Performers include Status Quo, the Incredible String Band, Donovan, the Bonzo Dog Doo-Dah Band, Julie Driscoll with Brian Auger and the Trinity, the Moody Blues, the Crazy World of Arthur Brown, Joe Cocker, the Move, Procol Harum, Cream, Jimi Hendrix and the Who

programme.title: Zappa (2020)
programme.desc: The first all-access documentary - years in the making - about Frank Zappa. It conveys the scope of his prodigious and varied creative output, and the breadth of his extraordinary personal and political life. The documentary team was granted exclusive access by Gail Zappa to a vast collection of Zappa's unreleased music, movies, incomplete projects, unseen interviews and unheard concert recordings. Much of these were deteriorating and in danger of being lost for ever

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1985: Mike Read and Gary Davies present the chart programme, first broadcast on April 25 1985, featuring Bronski Beat and Marc Almond, Phil Collins, New Model Army, DeBarge, Eurythmics, Freddie Mercury, David Grant and Jaki Graham and USA for Africa

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1988: Gary Davies and Nicky Campbell introduce the edition from April 24, featuring Pat and Mick, James Brown, Fairground Attraction, Brenda Russell, the Primitives, Luther Vandross, Joyce Sims, Bananarama, Will Downing, S'Express and Scott Fitzgerald

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: TOTP: 1994: Mark Goodier presents the chart show from August 8, 1994, featuring music by Maxx, Level 42, Ce Ce Peniston, Status Quo, Rozalla, Whitesnake, PJ and Duncan, Youssou N'dour with Neneh Cherry and Wet Wet Wet

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Destination Timbuktu: The former Monty Python star's expedition takes him to Senegal, where he witnesses a wrestling competition, visits jazz clubs, and meets soap star Marie-Madeleine. He also visits Bamako and Dogon country, then travels to Djenne, where he celebrates the Muslim Tabaski feast and secures a passage on a cargo boat to take him down the Niger River to Timbuktu
S01E02

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
North by Northwest: The intrepid traveller embarks on a trip from the Khyber Pass to the Bay of Bengal, an arduous journey through Pakistan's mountains, India, Nepal, China and finally Bangladesh. The adventure begins on the Khyber steam railway, taking in Darra, where he browses for a unique firearm. He then heads toward Chitral to watch a freestyle polo grudge-match take place on the highest polo field in the world
S01E01

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise tries to get closer to Jon, causing a jealous Alberte to challenge the profiler's cover story. Frederik discovers that one of Jon's old friends, who also owned Breidablik, perished in a mysterious fire. In Danish
S01E07

programme.title: Lost: Those Who Kill
programme.desc:
Louise and Frederik put pressure on Jon to accept responsibility for his actions, but once again he takes advantage of his relationship with Alberte. Louise decides to confront the past. In Danish
S01E08

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
The Curse of the Claw: An adventurer sets out to return sacred relic the Claw of the Holy Vulture to Burma to stop its curse falling on his family. Vintage comedy, starring Michael Palin
S01E06

programme.title: Ripping Yarns
programme.desc:
Whinfrey's Last Case: A dashing British hero suffers a conflict of loyalties on learning of the German plan to start the First World War a year early - on the same day as his annual Cornish fishing holiday. He elects not to either sacrifice his much-needed break but soon runs into an even more dastardly plot. Comedy, starring Michael Palin
S02E01

programme.title: Peter Sellers: A State of Comic Ecstasy
programme.desc: The comedy pioneer behind The Goon Show, Dr Strangelove and the Pink Panther series is explored in depth in this film surveying his meteoric rise to fame and troubled personal life. The film charts his formative years backstage as part of his parents' itinerant music hall revue group, his years of wartime service in India and Burma, through to his global superstardom. His two surviving children Sarah and Victoria recall the challenges of growing up alongside his mood swings, while his grandson Will explores the troubled legacy his grandfather left behind

programme.title: Dawn Chorus: The Sounds of Spring
programme.desc: Filmed without voiceover or music, this programme highlights the call of the birds at sunrise, as those living within Britain's habitats burst into song and reveal the natural splendour of their distinctive chorus

programme.title: Sahara with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
Destination Timbuktu: The former Monty Python star's expedition takes him to Senegal, where he witnesses a wrestling competition, visits jazz clubs, and meets soap star Marie-Madeleine. He also visits Bamako and Dogon country, then travels to Djenne, where he celebrates the Muslim Tabaski feast and secures a passage on a cargo boat to take him down the Niger River to Timbuktu
S01E02

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc:
North by Northwest: The intrepid traveller embarks on a trip from the Khyber Pass to the Bay of Bengal, an arduous journey through Pakistan's mountains, India, Nepal, China and finally Bangladesh. The adventure begins on the Khyber steam railway, taking in Darra, where he browses for a unique firearm. He then heads toward Chitral to watch a freestyle polo grudge-match take place on the highest polo field in the world
S01E01

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank heads for Mali to visit Dogon country, where he examines masks said to connect the land of the living with that of the dead, and admires ancient paintings

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: In a documentary originally broadcast in 1977, Sian Phillips introduces a Silver Jubilee year report on the contrary country west of Offa's Dyke, which is the pride of some of its inhabitants and the despair of many others

programme.title: Dance Passion Liverpool: Find the Feeling
programme.desc: A day in the life of the city through a series of dances, as soloists, choreographers and troupes - both amateur and professional - use pavements and landmarks as their stage, performing everything from high-energy Afrodance and beautiful ballet to energetic hopak and vibrant vogueing

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin

programme.title: The Price of Everything (2018)
programme.desc: Documentary that explores the labyrinthine art world of the 21st century and examines both the place of art and artistic passion in a money-driven, consumer-based society. Featuring collectors, dealers, auctioneers and artists including Jeff Koons, Gerhard Richter and Njideka Akunyili Crosby and Larry Poons, the film exposes deep contradictions as it holds a mirror up to the values of the modern era, coaxing out the dynamics at play in pricing the priceless

programme.title: For Folk's Sake: Morris Dancing and Me
programme.desc: Richard Macer infiltrates morris dancing's endangered world of bells, beer and beards, discovering that women may be the unlikely saviours of this ancient masculine tradition

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: In a documentary originally broadcast in 1977, Sian Phillips introduces a Silver Jubilee year report on the contrary country west of Offa's Dyke, which is the pride of some of its inhabitants and the despair of many others

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Yogyakarta to Ambarawa: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook
S01E13

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Keadby: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal
S04E01

programme.title: Inside the Bat Cave
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke presents a documentary taking a journey into the secret world of one of the most endangered and least understood animals on Earth - bats. With cutting-edge night-vision cameras and ultrasonic detectors, this programme follows a greater horseshoe bat roost for four months, capturing the hidden life of the colony as never before, witnessing the birth of a new generation of pups and tracking their progress towards their perilous maiden flights outside the roost

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc:
Barcelona: An Art Lovers' Guide: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Miró and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaudí
S01E02

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to Margaret Atwood, who traces her writing back to sagas that she invented with her brother as a child. She recalls an opera about fabrics that she wrote and performed at high school for a home economics project, how she staged puppet shows for children's parties, and the huge impact that reading George Orwell had on her

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc:
A Woman's Place: Documentary examining the impact of novels from three perspectives - the empire, class experience and, in this first film, women's voices. The programme aims to show the plight of women is a theme that reaches right back to the earliest novels, with extracts from Jane Austen, the Brontes, Mary Shelley and Virginia Woolf, through to the post-war publishing boom where a new generation of global writers such as Zadie Smith, Toni Morrison, Arundhati Roy and Margaret Atwood have continued to speak out for women to a new generation of readers
S01E01

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Yogyakarta to Ambarawa: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook
S01E13

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Sheffield to Keadby: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal
S04E01

programme.title: Craftivism: Making a Difference
programme.desc: Writer, comedian and art lover Jenny Eclair meets people doing extraordinary things with knitting, cross-stitch, banners and felt to change hearts and minds across the world

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ambarawa to Surabaya: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture
S01E14

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Keadby to Kiveton Park: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage
S04E02

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc:
Why?: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench
S02E04

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc:
Cold Feet: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam
S01E03

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc:
Beyond the Rainbow: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease
S01E03

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Ambarawa to Surabaya: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture
S01E14

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Keadby to Kiveton Park: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage
S04E02

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Penang to Kuala Kangsar: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools
S01E15

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Lincoln to Nottingham: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham
S04E03

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Michael Palin's Quest for Artemisia
programme.desc: The Monty Python star sets off on a quest to investigate the story of little-known 17th-century Italian artist Artemisia Gentileschi after one of her paintings caught his eye. Michael encounters her work in Florence, Rome and Naples, and finds out about her life as a working mother and her ultimate success against all odds as a great painter of the Baroque age who transformed the way women were depicted in art, and who was sought after in many courts across Europe

programme.title: East of Ipswich
programme.desc: Seventeen-year-old Richard Burrill is dragged to the seaside by his parents where he meets Edwin, another teenager with strong views on life, and a Dutch girl with an eye for the boys. Nostalgic comedy, starring John Nettleton and written by Michael Palin

programme.title: Victoria & Albert: The Royal Wedding
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley oversees a restaging of the wedding of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert. Aided by food historian Annie Gray, clothing expert Harriet Waterhouse and military historian Jasdeep Singh, she recreates the most important elements of the ceremony and the celebrations, scouring history books, archives, newspapers and Victoria's diaries for the exact details of the couple's big day in 1840. Lucy also recounts the story of Victoria and Albert's courtship and engagement, exploring the hidden iconography and symbolism of this hugely significant wedding and revealing new insights into the pair's relationship, both public and private

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Penang to Kuala Kangsar: Michael Portillo's 2,500-mile rail tour of south-east Asia reaches Malaysia. On the island of Penang, he traces the origins of the former British colony in Georgetown, rides one of the world's steepest funicular railways and is enchanted by exotic specimens at Malaysia's first butterfly sanctuary. Travelling on the nation's hi-tech railway network Michael visits its wettest town, Taiping, and learns how the discovery of tin made this land a prized possession for Britain. Next stop is the regal town of Kuala Kangsar, home to the Sultan of Perak and to one of Malaysia's most prestigious schools
S01E15

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
Lincoln to Nottingham: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham
S04E03

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
programme.desc: Michael Palin sets out to find the Indian sailors who took him on a slow boat from Dubai to Mumbai 20 years ago during the filming of his first travelogue Around the World in 80 Days. During an intense week at sea in 1988, he and the film crew learned to admire and respect the underpaid deckhands of the dhow Al Shama in whose hands they had placed themselves, and their farewell was a memorably emotional occasion. The return visit offers a chance to see how the teeming city has developed in the Asian economic boom and discover whether the ancient sailing ship is still afloat

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Kuala Kangsar to Cameron Highlands: Michael Portillo's rail exploration of South-east Asia continues in Malaysia, along the way learning how rubber engineering ensures railway passengers enjoy a smooth ride
S01E16

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc:
On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxton's famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters
S04E04

programme.title: Great Railway Journeys
programme.desc:
Great Railway Journeys of the World: Avid trainspotter Michael Palin fulfils a boyhood dream as he travels from Euston in London to Kyle of Lochalsh in Scotland. Part of The Golden Age of Steam season
S01E04

programme.title: A Fish Called Wanda (1988)
programme.desc: A stuffy English barrister representing a jewel thief is targeted by his client's partners in crime - a seductive American crook and her dim-witted would-be philosopher lover who will go to any lengths to discover where the diamonds from their last heist have been hidden. Crime comedy, starring John Cleese, Jamie Lee Curtis, Kevin Kline, Michael Palin and Tom Georgeson

programme.title: Blue Murder at St Trinian's (1957)
programme.desc: The mischievous schoolgirls travel by coach to Europe, accompanied by a wanted jewel thief dressed as a woman, and an undercover police detective. Comedy, starring Lionel Jeffries, Joyce Grenfell, Terry-Thomas, George Cole and Alistair Sim

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc:
Great British Comedies: Talking Pictures: Interviews with British comedy stars of the silver screen, featuring the likes of George Formby, Peter Sellers and the Monty Python team. Narrated by Sylvia Syms
S02E16

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc:

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 4/5: Holly Venning hosts the fourth dinner party from Cumbria and the food marketing manager wants to show her love for her home county through her menu. She prepares Cumbrian scallops and chorizo, followed by a traditional Cumberland sausage - but her Penrith fudge pudding doesn't appeal to everybody

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
Fun-loving Karen and Irena kick-off the competition in Nottingham with a menu of comfort food. On day two, Lee and Maemae cook up an Indonesian menu with a British twist. Finally, it's Clayton and Nina's turn to up the ante with an evening of French fine dining
S2020E08

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Phuket, Thailand: Amanda and Adam Cropper have been visiting Phuket in Thailand on holiday for some time and love it so much they decided to get married on the island. Now they're looking for their very own property there, initially to use as a holiday home before they move out full-time in the next few years. Jonnie Irwin guides them through the local market and shows them five properties for their £160,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Malaga: Martial arts experts Dan and Sally Ferretti from Bristol have travelled the world for competitions, but are now looking to relax. Despite never having been to southern Spain before, this adventurous couple have decided to buy their very own holiday home there, and have identified the mountains around Malaga as the perfect place. Danni Menzies is on hand to show them five great properties for their £80,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:
A family of five begin searching for their dream home in Italy, and it's panic stations in France as the glampsite hosts prepare for their first guests
S07E33

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
In Suffolk, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet former agony aunt Janet, whose garden shed is crammed with goodies. With no motors to unearth, Henry makes a rare furniture discovery, while Simon finds a vintage tram bench
S05E03

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 1/5: In the Manchester area, 27-year-old full-time mum Johanna, plans an evening dedicated to takeways from Turkey to China and India. Her guests are 34-year-old lorry driver Ryan, 48-year-old housewife Fiona, 45-year-old laundrette owner Linzi and 53-year-old translator Nico, on a night that includes a sojourn into Shakespeare

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 2/5: In Manchester, lorry-driving movie buff Ryan plans a film-inspired menu including his 'Prawn Identity' starter, 'Sausage Meat the Fockers' and 'Chocolate Clockwork Orange' desert. Unfortunately the first course is more of a disaster movie for Johanna, who has to face her fear of prawns. Meanwhile, Nico puts the cat among the pigeons with his views on male chefs and Fiona takes Linzi to task over her beauty regime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 3/5: Glamorous 'domestic delegator' Fiona aims to impress with a classy but effortless menu as she hosts the third dinner party of the week in the Manchester area. However, critical Linzi takes issue with Fiona's mother chopping her vegetables and her cousin making her honeycomb. Then, there's more trouble brewing as Nico and Johanna clash

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 4/5: Critical laundrette owner Linzi has been a hard taskmaster all week in the Manchester area, so expects to show her guests where they've been going wrong. She's not pleased when Ryan questions her choice of starter. When the guests find out what Linzi does for a job, Nico struggles to understand the concept of a laundrette. Self-proclaimed domestic delegator Fiona has to face her fears during Linzi's entertainment - an ironing competition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Manchester 5/5: On the final night in the Manchester area, Nico plans to show the Brits how it's done in the kitchen with his Italian cooking. He's been talking up his Italian heritage all week, and Linzi's convinced he's heading for a fall. Ryan's shocked by some of Nico's locker-room tales, while baby of the group Johanna horrifies the other female contestants with her thoughts on gender politics. It remains to be seen who will pick up the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Dénia: Newlyweds Alison and Gabriel from Greater Manchester have been together for five years and are looking to buy a property together in the town of Dénia on Spain's northern Costa Blanca. Craig Rowe lines up five properties for them to consider, all within their budget of £110,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Murcia: Lea and her best friend Fiona are on the hunt for a second home in the Murcia region of Southern Spain, somewhere Lea feels will also help husband Peter's arthritis symptoms. Property expert Scarlette Douglas summons on her expertise to line up five options within the £90,000 budget

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc:
Camden, 2012: Architect Henning Stummel and his partner Alice Dawson plan to convert a dilapidated joinery workshop in north London into a contemporary family home and office. They want to preserve the building's original steel frame, but to restore it they will have to take it down, which means carefully extracting it from the neighbours' walls without causing damage to their property - and that's just the start of the couple's problems. Kevin McCloud follows their progress
S12E08

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It: Brilliant Builds
programme.desc:
Brilliant Builds: Into the Garden: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back at two shows that highlighted the need to get the balance between home and garden just right. In Bury St Edmunds, Lauren Grant believes the opportunity to build on a land she and husband Christian bought from the council will transform their confused downstairs. He, however, just wants rid of the house altogether. Meanwhile, Harrogate couple Carol and Andrew need extra space for Grandad. Can Kirstie build into their sizeable garden or will Phil find somewhere else more suitable?
S01E06

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc:
The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows
S21E09

programme.title: xXx (2002)
programme.desc: Extreme sports star Xander Cage finds himself in trouble when his daredevil exploits land him behind bars. However, he is offered an intriguing escape route, courtesy of National Security Agent Augustus Gibbons - who thinks the adrenaline junkie is the perfect man to bring down a gang of international terrorists in Prague. Action adventure, starring Vin Diesel, Samuel L Jackson, Asia Argento, Marton Csokas and Michael Roof

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc:

S15E05

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc:
Anna Richardson presents as 22-year-old Ukrainian refugee Mariia enters the studio. Since fleeing the war, the pansexual sex therapist has settled in the UK and is now looking for love with a far-from-average man or woman who can keep up with her in the bedroom. She is followed by 24-year-old Alannah, a content creator from Bristol, who is seeking a forever bloke who can speak the language of love and feels comfortable in his body
S11E02

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc:
A cheesemaker meets a marketer with an endless line of jokes, and a company director and a fan of motorbikes and rockabilly share their love of the 1950s. Two gym enthusiasts seem to hit it off, but disaster strikes later in the night, while two executives with a taste for sharp suits seem like a good fit
S20E02

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc:
Jimmy Carr hosts as Roisin Conaty and Kiri Pritchard-McLean take on Jon Richardson and Rob Beckett. Comedian Hugh Davies is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate
S22E01

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria 5/5: Estate agent Wendy Tinnion helms the final event in Cumbria and decides to throw a Friday night disco for her fellow diners. However, her guests are in for a shock when they discover something unexpected about their host

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc:
In Nottingham, three rival couples compete to host the best dinner party and win £1,000. Ultra-competitive accountants Omer and Adeeba serve up an experimental Asian menu. Sustainable food growers Bobby and Alison, who live in a yurt in the grounds of a grand stately home, dish out homegrown, organic food under the stars. On the final night, Liz and Stuart host, and Stuart realises that it might be an uphill battle to impress their rivals. None of their guests is aware that Stuart and Liz don't actually live together, but questions are raised when Adeeba and Alison don't find any of Stuart's clothes in the master bedroom, and Omer and Bobby discover Stuart's campervan with a double bed parked outside
S2020E26

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Marbella: TV presenter Kim Woodburn and her husband Pete decide they would like to take ownership of a holiday home on the Costa del Sol, so Jonnie Irwin takes them to view five penthouses that meet their £320,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2016: Fuerteventura: With retirement rapidly approaching, Jan and Phil Jackson wish to relocate to the Canary Island of Fuerteventura, having been inspired by Jan's sister who has already made the move there. Property expert Scarlette Douglas shows them five detached villas within their £215,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc:

S07E34

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc:
On the Isle of Wight, Henry Cole finds an unusual three-wheeled motorbike and Simon O'Brien unearths an old projector screen that he wants to turn into a work of art
S05E04

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 1/5: In north Surrey, planning enforcement officer Becky is joined by singing teacher Petrina, drum teacher Rob, solicitor Shoba and building company boss Giovanni. Becky plans to delight her guests with an evening of modern home-cooking and a menu including butternut, lamb and a deconstructed apple dessert. The week gets off to an intriguing start with young gun Rob taking a shine to Petrina and vice versa

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 2/5: Solicitor Shoba hosts the second night in north Surrey, and tries to impress with an Indian-themed menu. However, the guests are less than impressed with the food, especially the main course - a curry made from frozen fish - but will a bit of belly dancing, Bollywood-style, help save the day? Meanwhile, singer Petrina and drummer Rob continue their flirting both at and away from the table

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 3/5: Drum tutor Rob hosts the third night in north Surrey, hoping his Thai-themed menu will impress his guests, as well as the object of his affections, Petrina. He serves prawns with lemon, lime and chilli for his starter, Thai chicken curry for his main, and rounds off with his own take on an ice-cream sundae. As a single man living in his stepmother's house, Rob thinks his competitors will see him as an underdog, so is intent on pulling out all the stops

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 4/5: Singing teacher Petrina hosts the fourth dinner party in north Surrey, and she believes her experience of entertaining on cruise ships will give her the edge as she plans a showstopper of an evening. However, the diners seem more interested in their host's continued flirting with fellow guest Rob. Will tonight be the night, or will he shy away when he discovers Petrina has sung in the West End and worked with dozens of household names?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: North Surrey 5/5: Giovanni hosts the final night of the competition in north Surrey, intent on flying the flag for Sicily with some family inspired recipes. Even with help from his father, a tagliatelle tragedy leaves him with Parmesan on his face. Becky is less than impressed with Giovanni's dishes, and matters go from bad to worse when he attempts to serve his home-made pasta. However, poor food doesn't deter a romantic Rob from popping the question to Petrina, sending shockwaves across the dining room. In a final attempt to bag the £1,000, Giovanni invites an opera singer to liven up the proceedings, but his musical initiative may prove too little to save the day

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2022: Valencia, Spain: Joe and Kirsty fell in love after meeting at work three years ago. Now they want to swap their house in Hampshire for their perfect home in the warmer climes of inland Valencia, Spain. With a maximum budget of £280,000, the pair look to property expert Jean Johansson to help them realise their dream

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: 2018: Mar Menor: Liverpool pair Jeanette and Ian have dreamed for years about owning a holiday home by Spain's popular Mar Menor, and with retirement approaching they feel it's the right time to make that dream come true. Scarlette Douglas impresses them with five properties to choose between within their budget of £75,000

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc:
South Norwood and Plumstead: The host takes on a classic 1930s terraced home with a kitchen that's so tiny the fridge and oven have to live in another room. The two mismatched fireplaces are causing marital strife, with one of the couple loving the original 1930s one, and the other favouring the Victorian reproduction. Only one fireplace can stay in George's new art deco-inspired scheme. Plus, he revisits a Victorian home where George previously helped renovate the bottom two floors
S06E05

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc:
A delivery driver is the victim of a carjacking and ends up being dragged along the road. On the M40, 13 stowaway migrants are found in a lorry full of tyres and in need of urgent medical care. A man collapses while having a fit in the middle of a busy road, and a woman experiences uncontrollable spasms in her legs at the stress of losing a child
S06E01

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc:
A 69-year-old man is rushed to St George's after collapsing on a tennis court, and the resus team has to work quickly to get his dangerously high heart rate under control. Other patients include a father suffering from shortness of breath and a young man who sustained a head injury playing football. Newly qualified consultant Mehrad recounts what it's like to work under pressure and the satisfaction of saving a patient's life
S24E01

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency?
programme.desc: One-off special following South Yorkshire Police investigating reports of bullying, from playground brawls and racism in schools, to coercive domestic abuse. Cases featured include a 14-year-old boy hospitalised by a gang in the street, a single vulnerable woman being systematically targeted by local teens in her own home, and a distraught mother watching her 27-year-old son attempting suicide after being bullied at work

For her £115,000 budget, Danni tees up five options for Peggy to see along with her mother Coral, but will any score a hole in one?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 1/5: In Guildford, Surrey, the first host is glamorous 22-year-old cosmetic-surgery-fan Shanice, who hopes to show she is more than just a pretty face by serving up sumptuous food and dazzling conversation. The guests she must impress are 32-year-old entertainer David, 69-year-old Norwegian plain-talker Vivi, 47-year-old super-competitive Neil and 25-year-old media sales worker Charlotte. With risky menu choices and a fellow diner's peculiar laughter taking the spotlight, will the conversations ranging from lookalikes to riding polar bears be enough to secure Shanice the prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 2/5: Retired estate agent Vivi hosts the second dinner party in and around Guildford. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 3/5: Sales manager Charlotte hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in and around Guildford, hoping to impress her guests enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, she has taken a huge risk with an Asian-inspired menu, which could prove to be too exotic for entertainments manager David

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 4/5: The penultimate day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sees children's entertainments manager David playing host. Having worked in the entertainments industry all his life, he is no stranger to showing people a good time, and employs his colleagues to put on a performance, while keeping his food simple. Is he forgetting the key ingredients of a dinner party?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Guildford 5/5: On the final day in and around Guildford, Surrey, sales director Neil devises a sophisticated menu, dismissing his predecessors' efforts as unambitious. However, his unusual fayre is tempered by his choice of yodelling entertainment, which threatens to hinder his chance of scooping the £1,000 prize

programme.desc:

programme.desc:

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Billionaire Blooms
programme.desc:
Cameras delve behind the scenes to observe the work of some of the UK's top florists as they create floral wonderlands for their super-wealthy clients. In this first episode, Jamie is in Italy for his toughest gig yet, the wedding of one of his most treasured clients. A multi-venue event spans four days and the length and breadth of Venice. Jamie needs to transport himself, his team of almost 40 and over 100,000 stems of the best flowers available everywhere by boat, in baking heat.
